channel.title: Morning Tax
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Tax examines the latest news in tax politics and policy.

item.title: A new status for Pillar Two
item.description: U.S. officials had said they hoped the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development would have approved changes to the minimum tax portion of the global tax deal by the end of 2025.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Can't stop talking about refunds
item.description: Top White House officials can’t stop talking about all the tax refunds coming people’s way in the upcoming filing season.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Still waiting on Pillar Two
item.description: The wait continues for the breakthrough on the U.S.’ effort to score a carveout to Pillar Two.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Decision time for states
item.description: State governments are facing a big question these days — how much to embrace the latest round of GOP tax cuts.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Good news for the big tax prep guys
item.description: At least for the time being, Intuit and H&R Block can now claim victory, at least when it comes to servicing taxpayers who can file to the federal government for free.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Working through that guidance
item.description: The Trump administration threw a bit of a wrinkle into the implementation of the “no tax on tips” provision on Friday.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker

item.title: Plug pulled on IRS chief counsel nominee
item.description: President Donald Trump submarined his own nominee for IRS chief counsel on Friday — and seemingly without warning.
item.dc:creator: By Bernie Becker
